value.title: How to get Secure Images in Power BI Reports
value.excerpt: Struggling getting images in your Power BI Report? Don't want to use anonymous URLs for the image? Patrick walks you through an approach to use secured images in your reports! value.title: Improve Power BI Report performance by using the filter pane

value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. Chris also looks at how change the behavior to make things a bit faster.  Data Privacy Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2018/12/27/data-privacy-settings-data-refresh-performance-power-bi-excel/

This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release. value.title: Slicer Restatement in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at a small feature called slicer restatement in Power BI. This feature will help you to determine what was selected in a slicer. value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/
